p:
The ORR activities of the oxides were examined by an LSV scan from 0.1 to 1.1 V vs. RHE with an electrode rotation speed of 1600 rpm at a scan rate of 10 mV s â€“1 in O 2-saturated 0.1 M KOH at ambient temperature. Electrolyte solutions were saturated by O 2 bubbling for 1 h prior to the measurements. The background correction to cancel capacitive currents was carried out using an LSV curve in N 2-saturated 0.1 M KOH without electrode rotation.
67 The electron transfer number ( n) during ORR was examined using an RRDE in O 2-saturated 0.1 M KOH solution at an electrode rotation speed of 1600 rpm. The ring potential was set at 1.39 V vs. RHE. The n was calculated using eq 4 , where i d is the disk current, i r is the ring current, and N is the collection efficiency of the ring electrode (0.37)
